doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Compare and report features of two similar sequences

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.label:
Word size (value greater than or equal to 2)?
The similar regions between the two sequences are found by creating a hash table of 'wordsize'd subsequences. 10 is a reasonable default. Making this value larger (20?) may speed up the program slightly, but will mean that any two differences within 'wordsize' of each other will be grouped as a single region of difference. This value may be made smaller (4?) to improve the resolution of nearby differences, but the program will go much slower.

Force reporting of differences at the start and end?
Yes No
Normally this program will find regions of identity that are the length of the specified word-size or greater and will then report the regions of difference between these matching regions. This works well and is what most people want if they are working with long overlapping nucleic acid sequences. You are usually not interested in the non-overlapping ends of these sequences. If you have protein sequences or short RNA sequences however, you will be interested in differences at the very ends . It this option is set to be true then the differences at the ends will also be reported.
Name of the report file
Choose the report output format Dasgff Dbmotif Diffseq Embl Excel Feattable Genbank Gff Listfile Motif Nametable Codata Regions Seqtable Simple Srs Swiss Table Tagseq

Name of the output feature file (e_aoutfeat)?
File for output of first sequence's features
Choose the feature output format Gff Embl Swissprot Nbrf Codata

Name of the output feature file (e_boutfeat)?
File for output of second sequence's features
Choose the feature output format Gff Embl Swissprot Nbrf Codata

parameter.name: e_wordsize
parameter.prompt: Word size (value greater than or equal to 2)

format.code: ("", " -wordsize=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 2 is required

comment.text: The similar regions between the two sequences are found by creating a hash table of 'wordsize'd subsequences. 10 is a reasonable default. Making this value larger (20?) may speed up the program slightly, but will mean that any two differences within 'wordsize' of each other will be grouped as a single region of difference. This value may be made smaller (4?) to improve the resolution of nearby differences, but the program will go much slower.
